<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 278, 325, 293]]<|/det|>
## ADDITIONAL MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 299, 153, 313]]<|/det|>
Paper 1  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 278, 904, 333]]<|/det|>
0606/11 October/November 2018 2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 338, 437, 374]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper. Additional Materials: Electronic calculator  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 390, 386, 406]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 718, 490]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in. Write in dark blue or black pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid. DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 501, 283, 515]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 515, 828, 575]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question. The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate. You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 584, 758, 628]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question. The total number of marks for this paper is 80.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[402, 73, 593, 87]]<|/det|>
Mathematical Formulae  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 165, 556, 180]]<|/det|>
## 1. ALGEBRA  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 196, 232, 211]]<|/det|>
Quadratic Equation  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 225, 370, 242]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(ax^{2} + bx + c = 0\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 243, 581, 278]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^{2} - 4ac}}{2a}.\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 301, 221, 316]]<|/det|>
Binomial Theorem  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[252, 322, 743, 358]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^{n} = a^{n} + \binom{n}{1} a^{n - 1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n - 2}b^{2} + \ldots +\binom{n}{r} a^{n - r}b^{r} + \ldots +b^{n},\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 367, 488, 405]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n - r)!r!}\)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[405, 470, 590, 485]]<|/det|>
## 2. TRIGONOMETRY  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 501, 152, 516]]<|/det|>
Identities  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 530, 580, 600]]<|/det|>
\[\sin^{2}A + \cos^{2}A = 1\] \[\sec^{2}A = 1 + \tan^{2}A\] \[\csc^{2}A = 1 + \cot^{2}A\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 630, 234, 644]]<|/det|>
Formulae for \(\Delta ABC\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[408, 651, 588, 683]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[406, 705, 590, 725]]<|/det|>
\[a^{2} = b^{2} + c^{2} - 2bc\cos A\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 732, 555, 760]]<|/det|>
\[\Delta = \frac{1}{2} bc\sin A\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 73, 97, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 144, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 742, 91]]<|/det|>
On the axes below, sketch the graph of \(\quad y = 3\cos 2x - 1,\)  for \(0^{\circ}\leqslant x^{\circ}\leqslant 360^{\circ}.\) 

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 102, 920, 428]]<|/det|>

<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 465, 443, 483]]<|/det|>
Given that \(\quad y = 4\sin 6x\) , write down

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 496, 180, 515]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 497, 337, 515]]<|/det|>
the amplitude of \(y\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 496, 920, 515]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 619, 310, 637]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 619, 920, 637]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[272, 75, 463, 95]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{p}(x) = 2x^{3} + 5x^{2} + 4x + a\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[272, 106, 428, 125]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{q}(x) = 4x^{2} + 3ax + b\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 136, 853, 156]]<|/det|>
Given that \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) has a remainder of 2 when divided by \(2x + 1\) and that \(\mathrm{q}(x)\) is divisible by \(x + 2\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 170, 144, 187]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 170, 505, 187]]<|/det|>
find the value of each of the constants \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 170, 920, 187]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 494, 610, 513]]<|/det|>
<pre>Given that \(\mathrm{r}(x) = \mathrm{p}(x) - \mathrm{q}(x)\) and using your values of \(a\) and \(b\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 526, 144, 543]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 526, 583, 543]]<|/det|>
find the exact remainder when \(\mathrm{r}(x)\) is divided by \(3x - 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 526, 920, 543]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 918, 108]]<|/det|>
The coefficient of \(x^{2}\) in the expansion of \(\left(2 - x\right)\left(3 + kx\right)^{6}\) is equal to 972. Find the possible values of the constant \(k\). [6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 92, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 75, 143, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 75, 722, 96]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 75, 920, 95]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 215, 143, 234]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[107, 339, 144, 357]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 266, 918, 300]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a circle with centre \(O\) and radius \(r\mathrm{cm}.\) The minor arc \(AB\) is such that angle \(AOB\) is \(\theta\) radians. The area of the minor sector \(AOB\) is \(48\mathrm{cm}^2.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 313, 144, 332]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 311, 310, 336]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 314, 920, 333]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 453, 143, 471]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 453, 710, 471]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 453, 920, 471]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[107, 747, 143, 765]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 747, 633, 765]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 747, 920, 765]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 83, 94, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 416, 104]]<|/det|>
A curve has equation \(y = \frac{\ln(2x^2 + 3)}{5x + 2}.\)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 126, 144, 145]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 123, 450, 152]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 128, 920, 147]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 564, 143, 583]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 564, 727, 583]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 565, 920, 583]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<label>7</label>

<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 269, 368, 295]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 275, 920, 293]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 522, 759, 540]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 75, 457, 92]]<|/det|>
Variables \(s\) and \(t\) are such that \(\quad s = 4t + 3\mathrm{e}^{- t}\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 107, 144, 125]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 107, 392, 125]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 107, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 184, 143, 202]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 179, 447, 205]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of \(t\) when \(\frac{\mathrm{ds}}{\mathrm{d}t} = 2\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 184, 920, 202]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 617, 144, 635]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 617, 828, 635]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 617, 920, 635]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 83, 104, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 140]]<|/det|>
Particle \(A\) is at the point with position vector \(\left(- \frac{2}{5}\right)\) at time \(t = 0\) and moves with a speed of \(10\mathrm{m}\mathrm{s}^{- 1}\) in the same direction as \(\begin{pmatrix} 3 \\ 4 \end{pmatrix}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 157, 143, 176]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 152, 920, 185]]<|/det|>
Given that \(A\) is at the point with position vector \(\begin{pmatrix} 38 \\ a \end{pmatrix}\) when \(t = 6 \mathrm{s}\), find the value of the constant \(a\). [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 195, 141, 215]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 191, 920, 217]]<|/det|>
Given that \(A\) is at the point with position vector \(\begin{pmatrix} 38 \\ a \end{pmatrix}\) when \(t = 6 \mathrm{s}\), find the value of the constant \(a\). [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 700, 845, 733]]<|/det|>
<pre>Particle \(B\) is at the point with position vector \(\begin{pmatrix} 16 \\ 37 \end{pmatrix}\) at time \(t = 0\) and moves with velocity \(\begin{pmatrix} 4 \\ 2 \end{pmatrix} \mathrm{m} \mathrm{s}^{- 1}\).

<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 733, 920, 752]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 428, 88]]<|/det|>

<mark>[4]

<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 75, 353, 93]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 106, 450, 123]]<|/det|>
